ygData.subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson is quickly hit by the barage of firepower, which this time, hit him luckilly in the back and not his head. He goes down hard, falling on his left side.

Tucson is quickly hit by the barage of firepower, which this time, hit him =
luckilly in the back and not his head. He goes down hard, falling on his le=
ft side.  The only sound that comes from him is a grunt of displeasure.  He=
 knew Rodimus would react as he did and in a way had positioned his body to=
 take the hit in a place where he knew would hurt immensely but would not c=
ause any loss of his senses.  

" I - have to admit, that - last shot was -=
 rather impressive."

He stays on the ground to make them think he was down=
 for the count, yet he had something else in mind. He didn't want to let th=
em know but he was already hard at work on a plan B.  He thinks to himself.=


"All right, so that didn't work according to plan, so if I'm going to res=
tore Rodimus, I'll have to do it when I get a cue from someone or something=
.  But for now, they took a cheap shot and it's time I returned the favor w=
ith one of my own."

He places his hands on the ground, and amzazingly enou=
gh with the strength he has left from the shot, he manages to hoist himself=
 up with a hand stand leading into a spring back up onto his feet.  He stum=
bles slightly.  He shrugs off what he thinks he can shrug off, and regroups=
 as best he can.  Now, instead of lying on the ground, he was concentrating=
 and side stepping his foe, with his hands positioned in unarmed combat, im=
plementing a form of Kung Fu, which originates from Earth, known as Crane S=
tyle, and mixing it with a bit of Cybertronian Know how.  After all, he was=
 partially trained as a Ninjabot and it was time he used those skills accor=
dingly.

" Nothing comes easy, and I'm aware of that.  I'm not here to take=
 the easy way out.  I said I'd do anything it took to restore my leader, an=
d I am willing to stand by my pledge, no matter the cost to my own spark.  =
So if it means comming dangerously close to my own mortality, I accept the =
challenge.   I am willing to fight anyone who wishes to challenge me, and I=
 pledge to fight in Warrior's honor." 

He waits to find out who will take =
him up on his offer.
--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercy=
clonus@...> wrote:
>
> Scourge quickly began moving his way around the room=
 in search of his illusive quarry. "It would seem that the Autobot has a li=
ttle skill in evasion." Scourge said under his breath, "But I will still ca=
tch him. 
> 
> Cyclonus nodded from his position near to Hydras. He had his=
 weapon drawn out and at the ready, but so far had no likely target. If he =
had been aware of Tuscon's thought that it was he that controlled this new =
Rodimus he would have laughed. So far there was only enmity covered by a wa=
rrior's respect that seperated the two. Cyclonus had no control over him in=
 the this new Dark Rodimus, that privalge went to Hydras and the other Pred=
acons who lived here. 
> 
> Rodimus continued to follow behind Scourge, his=
 loud foot falls sometimes earning him an annoyed glance from the hunter te=
rminator. Both were ready to fall on thier prey when suddenly . . . 
> 
> >=
 He gathers the strength to walk into where he could be seen,
> > judging b=
y the heat that lights were giving off, as faint as the
> > lights may be. =
 He stands before Cyclonus, and Scourge unarmed,
> > yet ready to defend hi=
mself if need be.
> > 
> > " Yes, you do have someone here.  And that someo=
ne is me.  I
> > don't know if you remember me or not, we may not have even=
 met.
> >  My name is Tucson and I'm proud to say that I am a member of the=

> > Autobot faction."  
> > 
> > He then senses Rodimus not too far away.
=
> > 
> > " All right, Rodimus, I have a question for you, and you may answe=
r
> > at will.  What was the very verse that brought the Matrix of Leadersh=
ip
> > to life, thus giving you the power of its spark?  I know you know th=
is,
> > and right now you may be hating my sorry servos, but I think I coul=
d
> > use a refresher on what it was.  Can you tell me?"
> > 
> 
> Rodimus =
straighted, he could feel Scourge behind him doing much the same thing. 
> =

> "The fool! Scourge said, disappoinment written all over his face as well=
 as covering his words. "I would have caught him, and now he walksd right i=
nto the open?"
> 
> Cyclonus also turned to look at the Autbot who stepped =
from the shadows, even as Darkhawk responded attempted to shoot the Autbot =
who called himself Tuscon. However the Autobot displayed a suprising amount=
 of dexterity as it not only shot once from his crossbow attempting to knoc=
k the weapon from Darkhawk's hand, , but then flipped over and attempted an=
other attack on him. 
> 
> As surprised as he was Cyclonus mearly reoriente=
d his weapon on the newly positioned Tuscon as Scourge did much the same th=
ing. 
> 
> Rodimus looked at Tuscon, no hint of recognition crossing his fa=
ce as he leveled his own weapon on him. "The only refresher you are going t=
o get here is a refresher in PAIN!" 
> 
> A trio of energy blasts lanced ou=
t at Tuscon as Cyclonus, Scourge and Dark Rodimus opened fire!
> 
> OOC: FY=
I Scourge's armor makes him generally invisible to sensors, which would inc=
lude sonar and radar. it also hides his heat personal signature as well.
